title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 January 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:17 <mflorea> has quit  
01:54 <CIA-123> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* ra871eb2 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-linkchecker/xwiki-platform-linkchecker-test/pom.xml : [misc] Fixing broken build - http://git.io/RErQPw  
02:06 <tekzilla> has quit  
02:10 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
04:04 <rickross> has quit  
09:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:15 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <mflorea> has quit  
11:03 <gdelhumeau> I have fixed my first app:  
11:03 <gdelhumeau> http://xwiki.kephpage.net/MacrosEditor.xar  
11:51 <CIA-123> tmortagne feature-extension-versions \* rfd8819b / (26 files in 11 dirs): XWIKI-7337: Implements Searchable in local and core extensions repositories ...  
13:12 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:21 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <rickross> has joined #xwiki  
14:23 <rickross> hi folks  
14:23 <@cjdelisle> howdy  
14:26 <rickross> I set up an XEM 3.3 test instance yesterday and have enjoyed exploring it  
14:26 <@cjdelisle> awesome, any questions you have, feel free to ask.  
14:27 <rickross> but I noticed a weird thing - in the first new wiki I created in the farm, there's a menu linking back to the main wiki, and it doesn't seem to resolve its string properties?  
14:27 <rickross> http://viper7.dzone.com:8080/wiki/testwiki/view/Main/WebHome  
14:28 <rickross> the items like workspacemanager.menu.mainwiki.admin  
14:28 <rickross> did I forget to load some string properties files someplace? (I just did a stock install following the instructions)  
14:28 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
14:31 <@cjdelisle> taking a look... I'm not familiar with the workspace manager application but usually the way it works is there are document bundles which add additional translations and they need to be referenced from the XWikiPreferences document.  
14:32 <rickross> ok, that could be connected - the "testwiki" was created with a template that XEM installed  
14:32 <rickross> templatexe, I believe  
14:32 <rickross> maybe it didn't have the required properties in it?  
14:38 <@cjdelisle> It should only be required that the document bundle is referred to in the main wiki.  
14:38 <@cjdelisle> http://viper7.dzone.com:8080/bin/view/AppWithinMinutes/Translations <-- this is the document bundle.  
14:39 <@cjdelisle> oops, that's the wrong one  
14:39 <rickross> I was confused :)  
14:39 <@cjdelisle> http://viper7.dzone.com:8080/bin/view/WorkspaceManager/Translations  
14:39 <@cjdelisle> that one  
14:40 <rickross> ok, cool - so the properties are definitely there, but somehow they are not referenced  
14:40 <@cjdelisle> From the administration interface in your main wiki, try going to the "Localization" tab and check to see WorkspaceManager.Translations is included in the "INTERNATIONALIZATION DOCUMENT BUNDLES" field.  
14:41 <@cjdelisle> (sorry for yelling, copy/paste)  
14:41 <rickross> thx, I will try to do that now (it is all still quite unfamiliar to me)  
14:42 <rickross> here's the list of bundles it has presently  
14:42 <rickross> XemResources.Translations,WikiResources.Translations,XAppResources.Translations, WorkspaceManager.Translations  
14:43 <+tmortagne> rickross: edit the http://viper7.dzone.com:8080/bin/view/WorkspaceManager/Translations document, probably mean it's actually a include of the one in main wiki  
14:43 <+tmortagne> this has been fixed but maybe only in 3.3.1  
14:43 <+tmortagne> checking  
14:46 <rickross> tmortagne, the strings in question appear to be present in the main wiki document, but the (child?) wiki "testwiki" doesn't seem to see them  
14:47 <rickross> what is the preferred term to describe spawned wikis in an XEM farm?  
14:51 <@cjdelisle> We usually call them subwikis.  
14:51 <+tmortagne> rickross: include is not supported with translations so that's why I asked you if http://viper7.dzone.com:8080/bin/view/WorkspaceManager/Translations was included  
14:52 <+tmortagne> there used to be the issue with apmanager and wikimanager fixed in 3.3 as far as i can see but maybe workspaces has the same kind of issue  
14:53 <rickross> tmortagne, I'm still getting my feet wet, so I may not have understood the question? Am I supposed to check if the mainwiki WorkspaceManager.Translations is referenced by inclusion in the subwiki?  
14:53 <+tmortagne> nop  
14:53 <+tmortagne> go to the page in the subwiki  
14:53 <+tmortagne> edit it in wiki mode  
14:53 <+tmortagne> and see if the translation are really here or if there are included (include macrp)  
14:53 <+tmortagne> s/macrp/macro/  
14:53 <rickross> ahh, ok  
14:55 <+tmortagne> just found that there is supposed to be a WorkspaceManager.TemplateTranslations too it seems so maybe the real issue if that WorkspaceManager.TemplateTranslations is not listed in XWikiPreferences  
14:55 <+tmortagne> "Various translations that are used in the workspace template and, implicitly, in the created workspaces"  
14:56 <+tmortagne> how did you created the wiki ?  
14:57 <rickross> I used XEM to create a new wiki  
14:57 <rickross> and filled in the form  
14:57 <rickross> I can give you an account with admin rights if you would like to step through to see if it is a bug  
14:58 <rickross> I cannot find a document in the subwiki that looks anything like WorkspaceManage Translations in the mainwiki  
14:59 <+tmortagne> there is several way to create wiki since 3.3 actually that's why I'm asking, there is the old WikiManager.CreateNewWiki and the new UI to create workspaces and maybe you are supposed to use the proper UI for workspace to be properly created  
15:00 <rickross> ok, I am getting terms confused again - I thought a Space equals a Workspace, which I understood to be a subsection of a Wiki  
15:00 <rickross> so I clicked "Create a new wiki" - possibly from the old interface  
15:01 <+tmortagne> the new "Workspace" in 3.3 is technically a subwiki but in which the fact that it's actually a separated wiki is a bit hidden  
15:01 <rickross> I would not have giessed that Workspace = Wiki  
15:01 <rickross> guessed  
15:02 <rickross> it is confusing, since each wiki also has SPaces  
15:02 <rickross> I will destroy that testwiki and make a new one with "Create a new Workspace"  
15:03 <+tmortagne> if what you want is a simple XE as subwiki you can create a new wiki without choosing any template with the old UI and then import a XE xar in it  
15:04 <+tmortagne> you can then make this new wiki a wiki template to create new wikis from this one or always to the import  
15:04 <rickross> http://viper7.dzone.com:8080/wiki/testwiki/view/Main/WebHome  
15:04 <rickross> the problem is not present on this new subwiki  
15:05 <+tmortagne> ok so it probably mean that when you create workspace some more is done after the wiki creation (don't know it very well)  
15:05 <rickross> hmm, good idea - we would probably preconfigure a base template that is ready to use for our anticipated use case  
15:06 <rickross> my deeper goal is to understand if I can achieve good integration with a Q&A solution DZone has built?  
15:06 <rickross> so we'd want to automate this stuff 100% , if possible  
15:07 <+tmortagne> ok  
15:08 <+tmortagne> as far as I know workspaces goal is to make easier to create wiki on demand for users that are not main wiki admins and allow them to setup users allowed to acces their workspace (so their wiki) etc...  
15:09 <rickross> very cool  
15:09 <rickross> I suspect that integrating with our AnswerHub system will require a lot of limiting the visibility of admin options  
15:09 <rickross> well, merging the admin into our core admin  
15:10 <rickross> but that's pretty far down the road - I am just trying to get a clear sense of what is possible  
15:10 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
15:10 <+tmortagne> probably but since most of the UI, admin included, is in wiki pages you can easily chhose which pages you want in your template  
15:10 <rickross> tmortagne, do you recommend installation of Admin Tools with XEM?  
15:10 <rickross> ahh, beautiful  
15:11 <+tmortagne> you mean the admin tool on extensions.xwiki.org ?  
15:11 <+tmortagne> s/on/from/  
15:11 <rickross> everything is really just wiki pages at some level, so if the template is modified, the admin access would no longer be present  
15:11 <rickross> yes, that is the one  
15:11 <+tmortagne> I don't know it very well but if you are using MySQL it's supposed to be pretty useful  
15:11 <+tmortagne> if you don't use MySQL it's unusable I think  
15:11 <rickross> I just put it in (I was lazy and didn't want to go make the mysql indexes :)  
15:12 <lucaa> has quit  
15:12 <+tmortagne> note that the mysql indexes are supposed to be automaticlaly created now  
15:12 <+tmortagne> since 3.2 I think  
15:12 <rickross> aha  
15:12 <+tmortagne> thanks to new hibernate version  
15:15 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:15 <rickross> drat, I was hoping that lack of indexes would explain why I am seeing slow performance on the main dashboard pages  
15:16 <rickross> it is taking up to 5+ seconds to produce these pages for some reason  
15:16 <rickross> http://viper7.dzone.com:8080/wiki/testwiki/view/Main/WebHome for example  
15:17 <rickross> this is a fast dual quad-core Xeon machine with loads of ram  
15:17 <rickross> and there's nothing else running on it  
15:17 <+tmortagne> the activity dashboard it's not very good, we need to improve it  
15:17 <rickross> and there's nearly no wiki content (except what came included with XEM)  
15:17 <+tmortagne> http://viper7.dzone.com:8080/wiki/testwiki/view/Main/AllDocs is much quicker for example  
15:18 <rickross> yes, the other pages are very snappy  
15:18 <rickross> most all of them  
15:18 <+tmortagne> in any case even without index with no wiki content that should not change much I think  
15:18 <rickross> so I hoped an index was missing on the homepage queries  
15:18 <+tmortagne> index changed the speed a lot when it's starting to contain lots of content I think  
15:19 <+tmortagne> if you really need this dashboard you could cache it using rendering cache or cache macro  
15:19 <+tmortagne> until we improve it  
15:19 <rickross> nope - I don't need it too much  
15:19 <rickross> I was just trying to get a feeling for whether I had installed correctly for good performance  
15:20 <rickross> I'm just a noob exploring :)  
15:20 <+tmortagne> still feel pretty long even for activity dashboard  
15:21 <rickross> it's that "first impression" thing  
15:21 <rickross> since that is the default page for the wiki  
15:21 <rickross> it won't satisfy the guys who expect sub-second page response  
15:21 <+tmortagne> yep it's not very cool right now  
15:22 <rickross> everyone on my end will be comparing to Confluence  
15:22 <rickross> and "Confluence this.. Confluence that…" yada yada yada :)  
15:26 <rickross> btw, just so I say it explicitly - XWiki seems like really excellent software  
15:26 <vmassol> rickross: show them App Within Minutes :) http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/App+Within+Minutes+Application  
15:26 <vmassol> (nice to see you back here btw :))  
15:26 <+tmortagne> always nice to hear :)  
15:26 <rickross> Vincent, you can be sure I noticed that one :)  
15:27 <vmassol> (sorry I'm on holidays so I couldn't answer your questions)  
15:27 <rickross> no worries - I am supposed to be on holidays , too  
15:27 <vmassol> hehe  
15:27 <rickross> but, in truth, exploring new stuff is what I like to do for fun :)  
15:28 <rickross> so, this IS holidays :)  
15:28 <vmassol> yeah me too but wife and kids don't always think like I do …. ;)  
15:28 <rickross> well, you're probably younger - that will pass :)  
15:28 <vmassol> nice one  
15:28 <vmassol> :)  
15:29 <rickross> your kids get older, then THEY are the ones glued to the screens (facebook, tumblr, twitter, etc)  
15:29 <rickross> and you'll be bitching at them to have a life  
15:29 <vmassol> right  
15:29 <vmassol> the eldest is 13 so that will happen real soon now  
15:30 <rickross> I'm surprised if it didn't already  
15:30 <rickross> that's about the age of my youngest - my oldest is almost 28 - it hasn't changed  
15:31 <rickross> I strongly recommend blocking tumblr.com - that is "internet crack"  
15:31 <vmassol> ok thank for the advice, I'll watch out for this one  
15:33 <rickross> hmm, is there additional configuration required for the Invitations app?  
15:34 <vmassol> you're lucky cjdelisle is the expert on the invitation app!  
15:34 <rickross> This configuration cannot be displayed because it was last edited by http://viper7.dzone.com:8080/wiki/workspacetemplate.template.local/create/XWiki/Admin?parent=XWiki.XWikiPreferences who doesn't have permission to edit this page.  
15:34 <vmassol> just the smtp config I think  
15:38 <rickross> do subwikis inherit users and groups form the main wiki (or, at least Admin users?)  
15:38 <+tmortagne> nop  
15:38 <+tmortagne> except for admin users  
15:40 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
15:42 <CIA-123> tmortagne feature-extension-versions \* rf1b20a7 / (6 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7340: Return total hits in versions and extensions REST requests ...  
15:45 <rickross> do you guys have a preferred method to post screenshots of borked pages?  
15:46 <rickross> I suppose I should learn to use my xwiki to do it :)  
15:46 <vmassol> rickross: either in a jira issue or personally I use skitch  
15:46 <vmassol> (there are other pastebin like tools for images too)  
15:46 <vmassol> yeah using xwiki would do that :)  
15:46 <vmassol> (your wiki)  
15:46 <+tmortagne> depends, if it's a bug then you can put it in the jira issue for it  
15:47 <rickross> since I am a total noob, I will not be quick to call anything a bug :)  
15:47 <rickross> but I definitely cannot use the Invitation Application in my subwiki  
15:48 <rickross> it seems to be configurable in the main wiki, but it's a no-go in the subwiki  
15:48 <vmassol> rickross: you can use http://tinycoke.com/  
15:50 <rickross> hmm, Annotations, Invitation Application and Search all exhibit the same problem  
15:51 <rickross> every other page linked from the Workspace Admin left sidebar seems to work  
15:51 <rickross> but those three all say "This configuration cannot be displayed because it was last edited by http://viper7.dzone.com:8080/wiki/workspacetemplate.template.local/create/XWiki/Admin?parent=XWiki.XWikiPreferences who doesn't have permission to edit this page."  
15:54 <@cjdelisle> That message is a safety feature to prevent people from creating admin pages then using them for privilege esculation.  
15:55 <@cjdelisle> The fact that workspacetemplate.template.local is not translated properly seems to break the link.  
15:56 <rickross> is there an alternate way to configure the Invitation Application?  
15:56 <rickross> well, that didn't have the expanded link on the page  
15:57 <rickross> it was correct text, linking "Admin"  
15:57 <rickross> but how can Admin not have sufficient rights?  
15:57 <@cjdelisle> Try going to the administration interface in the subwiki and then going to "Localization" and check which document bundles are referenced.  
15:59 <@cjdelisle> My little hypothesis here is that it might reference a nonexistant WorkspaceManager.Translations which overrides the WorkspaceManager.Translations in the main wiki.  
16:00 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
16:00 <CIA-123> tmortagne feature-extension-versions \* rd491502 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-handler/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/repository/xwiki/internal/XWikiExtensionRepository.java : XWIKI-7240: Add support for special versions qualifiers and version ranges ...  
16:00 <rickross> http://tinycoke.com/img/6r1WZHsXzTewU.png  
16:02 <@cjdelisle> You can fix that by resaving the documents which are referenced (Invitation.WebHome and Invitation.InvitationConfig)  
16:02 <rickross> ok, so I would go to the document index, find those two and open and resave?  
16:03 <@cjdelisle> you can click on the links in the page you screenshotted.  
16:03 <@cjdelisle> screenshot? screenshotted?  
16:03 <@cjdelisle> screencapped.  
16:04 <rickross> ahh, much nicer!  
16:04 <rickross> good question, I would say screen-capped  
16:04 <rickross> but that is botched English  
16:05 <@cjdelisle> I had an English teacher who said I "shot from the hip".  
16:07 <rickross> ok, that technique worked for all three of the applications that showed the problem  
16:07 <rickross> but why did they show it in the forst place?  
16:07 <rickross> shouldn't the subwiki be ready to go when it is created?  
16:07 <@cjdelisle> I think it's a reminent of the translation problem.  
16:07 <rickross> should I file an issue?  
16:08 <@cjdelisle> Is it still showing up?  
16:09 <@cjdelisle> I think a bug issue is in order but I would like to understand what caused the translations not to be applied despite being referenced from the main wiki.  
16:12 <rickross> editing and saving the various pages from within the subwiki cleared the symptom  
16:12 <rickross> but I suspect that if I create another subwiki, it'll start off wrong again  
16:12 <rickross> I will test now  
16:13 <@cjdelisle> The issue with workspacemanager.menu.mainwiki.admin showing up was fixed?  
16:13 <rickross> when I created the subwiki with "Create a new workspace." on the main wiki dashboard, that translation was properly included  
16:14 <@cjdelisle> ahh so it was resolved.  
16:14 <rickross> I used some other link to create the first subwiki, and it was untranslated when I did it that way  
16:14 <rickross> I don't remember what other link it was - probably the one from the referenced old manager page  
16:15 <@cjdelisle> one of the nice things is you can script all of this and just have one button.  
16:16 <@cjdelisle> one of the not-so-nice things is supporting older code means a number of APIs doing the same things.  
16:16 <rickross> I don't know if you can access this  
16:16 <rickross> http://viper7.dzone.com:8080/wiki/apptest/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=Invitation  
16:16 <@cjdelisle> I can't.  
16:17 <rickross> I made a new workspace, and the config page is showing the same message as the first one did  
16:17 <@cjdelisle> let me check if Admin user is there.  
16:17 <rickross> but if I edit and save the referenced pages, I think it will work  
16:18 <@cjdelisle> there is no Admin user so either you need to add the Admin user back to the template you are using or resave those documents in the template.  
16:19 <rickross> I believe that template was the original provided by XEM 3.3  
16:19 <@cjdelisle> ahh, there is a bug.  
16:20 <rickross> btw, should I have installed this from svn instead of from the .war download?  
16:20 <@cjdelisle> The .war should be the most stable.  
16:21 <rickross> that missing Admin is affecting thre apps: Annotation, Invitation and Search  
16:21 <rickross> all three have the same symptom  
16:22 <@cjdelisle> There will be others as well such as the document livetable for attachments.  
16:22 <+tmortagne> removing Admin user from the template was a mistake that has been fixed now I think  
16:23 <+tmortagne> hmm maybe not actually  
16:23 <+tmortagne> in any case the user is removed on purpose by workspaces  
16:23 <+tmortagne> (wrong purpose IMO)  
16:24 <rickross> ahh, so this is a feature :)  
16:24 <@cjdelisle> heh  
16:24 <+tmortagne> could say that  
16:26 <+tmortagne> anyway it probably worth a jira issue, whatever the way it's fixed part of the workspace admin is unusable it seems  
16:26 <@cjdelisle> indeed, I can think of a few other places which will have trouble, eg: attachments livetable.  
16:27 <+tmortagne> these have trouble anyway because they need programming right, having a local admin user will not help much  
16:28 <@cjdelisle> ahh I see  
16:28 <abusenius> has quit  
16:28 <+tmortagne> all this was supposed to be fixed by http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7298 but it has been vetoed  
16:28 <rickross> it's not SOOO terrible to have to edit and save those pages, but as a noob admin I wouldn't have known that was what I needed to do  
16:28 <+tmortagne> rickross: yep it's a bug, this should not be required  
16:29 <rickross> IMO, everything in the default admin sidebar should work in a new workspace, by default  
16:29 <+tmortagne> I agree  
16:29 <rickross> do you guys prefer apache or nginx as a front-end webserver?  
16:30 <rickross> I don't think I'll leave it just running on Tomcat  
16:30 <+tmortagne> we usually use apache but I could not explain you why, I don't know nginx very well  
16:31 <rickross> I don't know nginx either - apache is familiar  
16:31 <rickross> but, since I am exploring, I may as well try out nginx, too :)  
16:32 <@cjdelisle> Another option in the "faster" direction is lighttpd, a friend of mine swears by it.  
16:32 <@cjdelisle> But then I don't know webservers very well myself.  
16:32 <rickross> we do a "multi-tenant, multi-site" approach to hosted Q&A in our Java solution, and I wonder how that can integrate with xwiki?  
16:33 <rickross> xwiki appears to be making a new database for each subwiki  
16:33 <@cjdelisle> It does.  
16:34 <rickross> so federated user management isn't going to be easy, I guess?  
16:34 <+tmortagne> you can share user accross all wiki by putting them on main wiki  
16:34 <+tmortagne> that usually what we do in a farm  
16:34 <+tmortagne> like xwiki.org for example  
16:35 <vmassol> if you wish you can have all the users created on the main wiki or use another auth like ldap  
16:35 <rickross> nice  
16:35 <rickross> so, we could somehow export the auth to our core app's user management, anyway?  
16:36 <rickross> but we could hit limits of open tables and files if we tried to put too many subwikis on a single system  
16:36 <+tmortagne> yep, you can create you own XWiki auth which authenticate on you own based sync xwiki users on main wiki  
16:36 <+tmortagne> that's what we ddo with LDAP generally  
16:36 <vmassol> rickross: at some point we had a farm with over 10K wikis on it  
16:36 <rickross> I'm not sure it'll matter much - the actual use cases we have encountered for customers are different than what we originally imagined  
16:37 <rickross> so we might make wiki integration an option for the higher-end customers  
16:37 <rickross> but I really love the idea of wiki integration with Q&A  
16:38 <vmassol> I'd love to see that too :)  
16:38 <rickross> and I know you guys do wiki better thanwe ever will  
16:38 <vmassol> (as we had discussed)  
16:38 <rickross> and we do Q&A pretty well :)  
16:38 <rickross> it would be cool to migrate your FAQ into our system  
16:38 <+tmortagne> yep  
16:39 <vmassol> yup  
16:41 <CIA-123> tmortagne feature-extension-versions \* rcd8baf4 / (1123 files in 54 dirs): Merge branch 'master' into feature-extension-versions ...  
16:42 <rickross> I'm sorry this didn't move forward earlier - the two guys I had assigned this to spent time and produced nothing, but they were moaning about having problems installing and all kinds of stupid complaints  
16:42 <rickross> and I really didn't believe them, so when I had time over the holidays I decided to try it myseld  
16:42 <rickross> myself, and it was totally easy to setup (well, not totally, but pretty easy)  
16:43 <rickross> I'm sure they just didn't follow your instructions carefully (which really annoys me)
